newsitem.title: POLAND: OPTIMUS TO SELL PHILIPS' MONITORS.
newsitem.headline: OPTIMUS TO SELL PHILIPS' MONITORS.

text.p: Dutch Philips Electronics NV signed a coooperation agreement on Wednesday with Polish computer maker Optimus SA on distributing its computer monitors in Optimus's retail net, the chief of Philips' Polish unit said.
"From now on Philips computer monitors will be offered in Optimus net," Jaap C. van Oost told a news conference.
He said Philips targeted a 10-percent computer monitors market share in Poland. He declined to say what the market share was at present.
Optimus president Roman Kluska, also present, said Philips and Optimus were also thinking of cooperating in production, but said it was too early to reveal any details.

Philips, which has so far invested $130 million in Poland, has majority stakes in seven Polish companies. Its turnover in Poland doubled last year to $300-350 million, compared with 1994. -- Malgorzata Rzepka +48 22 653 9700
